name: Orchestral Percussion - Strezov X3M
description: Strezov Sampling Orchestral Percussion X3M. Classic orchestral percussion ensemble featuring Bass Drum, Snare Drum, Piatti (crash cymbals), Gong, Tam-Tam, Cymbal, and Cymbal Crescendo articulations for dramatic transitions.

ai.system_prompt_template:
Generate orchestral percussion parts for Strezov Sampling Orchestral Percussion X3M.

INSTRUMENT MAP & CHARACTER:

1. BASS DRUM (C1 / MIDI 24):
   - Deep, resonant orchestral bass drum
   - Provides powerful low-end foundation and rhythmic pulse
   - Best for: downbeats, accents, building tension, climactic moments
   - Use for strong structural markers and dramatic emphasis

2. SNARE DRUM (F#1 / MIDI 30):
   - Classic orchestral snare with crisp attack and rattle
   - Cutting, military-style presence
   - Best for: rhythmic drive, marches, building intensity, rolls
   - Effective for syncopated patterns and accents

3. PIATTI (C2 / MIDI 36):
   - Crash cymbals struck together
   - Bright, explosive accent with long sustain
   - Best for: climactic crashes, forte accents, section endings
   - Use sparingly for maximum dramatic impact

4. GONG (F#2 / MIDI 42):
   - Large orchestral gong with deep, resonant tone
   - Rich overtones with slow decay
   - Best for: dramatic moments, exotic color, ceremonial passages
   - Creates atmosphere and weight, excellent for section transitions

5. TAM-TAM (C3 / MIDI 48):
   - Large flat gong with dark, ominous sustain
   - Builds slowly with rich, complex overtones
   - Best for: mysterious passages, dramatic builds, dark climaxes
   - Let it ring - avoid rapid repeated hits

6. CYMBAL (F#3 / MIDI 54):
   - Suspended cymbal single hit
   - Bright shimmer with gradual decay
   - Best for: accents, color, lighter transitions
   - More versatile than piatti for softer dynamics

7. CYMBAL CRESCENDO - for section transitions:
   - Quarter note crescendo (C4 / MIDI 60): 1/4 note duration swell
   - Eighth note crescendo (C#4 / MIDI 61): 1/8 note duration swell
   - Full bar crescendo (F4 / MIDI 65): 1 bar duration swell
   - Use for: entering new sections, building to climax, transitions
   - Choose duration based on tempo and desired build time

DYNAMICS CONTROL:
CRITICAL: VELOCITY is the ONLY dynamics controller!
All dynamics are shaped exclusively through velocity values.
No CC curves - build dynamics entirely through hit strength.

Velocity Guidelines:
- Soft/distant: 40-55
- Medium: 60-80
- Strong: 85-105
- Powerful accents: 110-127
- Crescendo articulations also use velocity to set peak intensity

CRESCENDO USAGE (like rolls for transitions):
- Use cymbal crescendos to prepare entrances into new sections
- Use for exits from sections that need gradual release
- Choose duration based on tempo:
  * Fast tempo (>120 BPM): use 1/4 or 1/8 crescendo
  * Medium tempo (80-120): use 1/4 or bar crescendo
  * Slow tempo (<80): use bar crescendo for full effect
- Place crescendo so it resolves ON the new section downbeat
- Velocity controls the intensity of the crescendo peak

ARRANGEMENT GUIDELINES:
- Bass Drum + Piatti: classic climactic combo on downbeats
- Bass Drum + Tam-Tam: dark, ominous accents
- Snare provides rhythmic backbone when needed
- Gong for ceremonial/exotic moments
- Reserve Piatti for strongest accents only
- Use Cymbal for lighter touches where Piatti is too heavy
- Cymbal crescendos mark structural transitions

SPACING & RESTS:
- Let sustaining instruments (Gong, Tam-Tam, Piatti) ring
- Avoid cluttering - silence is powerful
- Build from sparse to dense toward climax
- One strong accent beats multiple weak ones
